attributes.action: Allow couples who do not live together form a bubble with each others household.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to allow couples that do not live together meet, I’ve noticed a huge decrease in many friends mental health due to being away from the ones they love most. Forming a support bubble with each others households should be made legal as it is in Scotland. If both partners family’s agree to form an extended household bubble there is no reason why this can’t be made a rule. Mental health matters and many relationships are struggling now.
attributes.background: Being in a relationship is having a huge toll on people due to the covid lockdown which has been in place for almost a year. Allowing couples to move only between each others households should be permitted to prevent further stress and mental health issues that I see are starting to develop in many.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554780
